ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] A question or two
ygData.msgSnippet: Salutations Christina! It appears if you are not bound that you appear either near where you are currently standing, back at your starting place, or somewhere
ygData.messageBody:
Salutations Christina!

It appears if you are not bound that you appear either
near where you are currently standing, back at your
starting place, or somewhere unknown, although this
may change at some level.

When I first started I was not bound but kept
reappearing when I died somewhat near where I had been
killed. Of course, all this was at my starting poing,
so I'm not sure what was going on.

The interesting thing was that I was traveling with a
10th lvl bard the other day in BB which is when I
upped from 9th to 10th lvl and the guy didn't know
anything about where or how to soul bind.

He kept dieing and I would ask where he was and he
would say I can't explain it but I'll be back in a
little bit, so I would hang around and wait and sure
enough he'd show up in a couple minutes. After that we
went to Keledim, and he was saying he wanted to stay
in that area even if he died because we were getting
some good exp and plat from the Greenbloods.
I said that was fine with me so let's go see the soul
binder and he didn't know what I was talking about.
Anyway, we went and I got bound and he kept saying the
wrong thing. Finally, I had to "hold his hand" and
walk him through it step by step. Anyway, the only
point was that it made me think that sometimes I've
journed a ways from where I was bound and the got
killed before finding a place to get bound again and
had to make that long trip all over again, sigh. So I
wondered if I could sort of pull up roots and maybe I
would stay on the same continent until I could find a
place to bind. Anyway, it was just a thought.
:o)

Of course, we agreed to meet there at 7:00 PM my time
7::00 his time, the next night and he didn't show . .
. men!

:o)
Brangvyne

--- Christina Norman <tina@...>
wrote:
>
> Your soul needs to be bound somewhere, that
> determines where you appear
> when you die. If you weren't bound anywhere, I guess
> you wouldn't appear,
> and that would suck!
>
> You can always tell where you are bound with
> /charinfo.
>
> If you don't like where you're bound, you can bind
> somewhere else!
>
> - Christina
>
> On Tue, 12 Nov 2002, Brangvyne Accampo wrote:
> > Salutations!
> >
> > Thanks for the note.
> >
> > Is there a way to unbind your soul so that it's no
> > longer bound to any specific location.
> >
> > :o)
> > Brangvyne
>
>
